intro: Myogalum, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a striking contrast between the petals and the green calyx. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Myogalum species are often found in woodlands, meadows, and along stream banks. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, providing a textured appearance.
